intro: Houstonia umbellata, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stems. Houstonia umbellata is often found in coastal dunes, prairies, and other disturbed areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
